intro: Dissochaeta cinnamomea, commonly known as cinnamon beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. Dissochaeta cinnamomea is a perennial herb that is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
